Name: Relief with inscription
Description: Relief depicting Ramesses II with his mother. They are both bearing offerings to Osiris who is seated on a throne on the left. Only one arm and both legs of the god have been preserved. Ramesses is wearing the blue crown, a short kilt with bead pendants and a long garment reaching his ankles. In his hands, held up in a gesture of adoration, Ramesses is holding an incense burner and a washing basin. Between him and Osiris is an offering stand with a wash basin and a large lotus flower on it. Tuya is wearing the vulture head-dress and a long flowing garment. In her hands she is holding a hes-vase and a sistrum.
